sentences.english: Matters are very complex. It's very difficult to find a single solution to all problems.
sentences.chinese: 事情错综复杂，很难找到一个一了百了的解决办法。

sentences.english: Is it true can die on the end of it?
sentences.chinese: 难道死了就真的能够一了百了了吗？

sentences.english: Or the total and immediate end of Qaddafi's four-decade rule?
sentences.chinese: 抑或是一了百了，立即结束卡扎菲四十年的统治？

sentences.english: Mostly I wished I was dead.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望自己已经死了，好一了百了。

definition: to end one's suffering by dying quickly and being reincarnated/(fig.) to get it over with
to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
to attempt suicide/to court death
to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
go to hell!/drop dead!
to kill/to put to death
better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4

definition: lit. two segments with a single cut (idiom)/fig. to make a clean break (idiom)
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
to have no cares/to be carefree
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
obscure/dubious/shady
to kill oneself/suicide
lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
early demise/untimely death
